docs.lead_paragraph: I'm sorry to report a sex scandal in the heart of the Bush administration. Worse, it doesn't involve private behavior, but public conduct. You see, for all the carnage in President Bush's budget, one program is being showered with additional cash -- almost three times as much as it got in 2001. It's ''abstinence only'' sex education, and the best research suggests that it will cost far more lives than the Clinton administration's much more notorious sex scandal.
docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column scores Bush admininstration for showering yet more money on sex education programs that call for 'abstinence only,' saying such programs may well result in more pregnancies, abortions, gonorrhea and deaths from AIDS; holds abstinence-only education is not primarily about promoting abstinence, but rather about blindly refusing to teach contraception (M)
docs.snippet: Abstinence-only education isn't about abstinence but about refusing to teach contraception.

docs.lead_paragraph: In their search for middle ground on the subject of abortion, Democrats are encountering a mixture of resistance and retreat from abortion rights advocates in their own party. Since its defeats in the November elections, nothing has put the fractured soul of the Democratic Party on display more vividly than abortion. Party leaders, including Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton of New York and the new chairman, Howard Dean, have repeatedly signaled an effort to recalibrate the party's thinking about new restrictions on abortion.

headline.main: For Democrats, Rethinking Abortion Position Meets With Mix of Reactions in Party

docs.abstract: Democrats seeking middle ground on subject of abortion are encountering mixture of resistance and retreat from abortion-rights advocates in their own party; Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee's efforts to recruit abortion opponents to run for Senate in 2006 has roiled some party loyalists and groups like Emily's List, which raises money for female candidates who support abortion rights; Naral Pro-Choice, on the other hand, is droppings its opposition to proposed bill to require doctors to offer anesthetic for fetuses of women seeking abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy (M)
docs.snippet: Democrats are encountering a mixture of resistance and retreat from abortion rights advocates in their own party.
